questions.question_text: How is a SIEM tool used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D would be the correct one. Other are either too specific or to simple.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

choices.C: To compare security alerts against configured scenarios and trigger system responses
choices.A: To collect security data from authentication failures and cyber attacks and forward it for analysis
choices.B: To search and compare security data against acceptance standards and generate reports for analysis
choices.D: To collect and analyze security data from network devices and servers and produce alerts

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is reverse engineering a suspicious file by examining its resources. What does this file indicate?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The file in question indicates a DOS MZ executable format. The MZ signature at the beginning of the file (as seen in the hexadecimal representation) is characteristic of an executable file format for DOS. This signature, combined with the text "This program cannot be run in DOS mode," which is typically included as a message in DOS MZ executables to be displayed when they are run in a non-DOS environment, confirms that the file is a DOS MZ executable.
If you look the Majic is 4D and 5A coupled with "can not be run in DOS mode", indicates it is DOS MZ!

Selected Answer: A
The DOS MZ executable format is the executable file format used for. EXE files in DOS. The file can be identified by the ASCII string "MZ" (hexadecimal: 4D 5A) at the beginning of the file (the "magic number").

Selected Answer: D
C or D no idea.

Selected Answer: D
D. The malware contains an encryption and decryption routine to hide URLs/IP addresses and is storing the output of loggers and webcam captures in locally encrypted files for retrieval.

The indicator of compromise in this scenario is:

D. The malware contains an encryption and decryption routine to hide URLs/IP addresses and is storing the output of loggers and webcam captures in locally encrypted files for retrieval.

ChatGPT

D. The malware contains an encryption and decryption routine to hide URLs/IP addresses and is storing the output of loggers and webcam captures in locally encrypted files for retrieval.

An indicator of compromise (IOC) is a characteristic of an attack that can be used to identify it. In this scenario, the malware is capturing keys and webcam events on a company server. One way it could do this is by using an encryption and decryption routine to hide URLs/IP addresses and storing the output of loggers and webcam captures in locally encrypted files for retrieval. This behavior is an indicator of compromise, as it shows that the malware is attempting to hide its tracks and steal sensitive information from the company.

Selected Answer: D
based on that the code is all about encrypting, the obvious answer is D

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is performing a static analysis on a malware and knows that it is capturing keys and webcam events on a company server. What is the indicator of compromise?

choices.D: The malware contains an encryption and decryption routine to hide URLs/IP addresses and is storing the output of loggers and webcam captures in locally encrypted files for retrieval.
choices.B: The malware is a ransomware querying for installed anti-virus products and operating systems to encrypt and render unreadable until payment is made for file decryption.
choices.A: The malware is performing comprehensive fingerprinting of the host, including a processor, motherboard manufacturer, and connected removable storage.
choices.C: The malware has moved to harvesting cookies and stored account information from major browsers and configuring a reverse proxy for intercepting network activity.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
PCI DSS is the compliance for Credit Cards

questions.question_text: An audit is assessing a small business that is selling automotive parts and diagnostic services. Due to increased customer demands, the company recently started to accept credit card payments and acquired a POS terminal. Which compliance regulations must the audit apply to the company?

A customer is using a central device to manage network devices over SNMPv2. A remote attacker caused a denial of service condition and can trigger this vulnerability by issuing a GET request for the ciscoFlashMIB OID on an affected device. Which should be disabled to resolve the issue?

discussion.content: A. SNMPv2 should be disabled to resolve the issue. The vulnerability is related to SNMPv2 and can be triggered by issuing a GET request for the ciscoFlashMIB OID. Disabling SNMPv2 or restricting access to SNMPv2 is the recommended solution.
